title: What are the highest paying jobs in Ethiopia? - Quora

response.answer_text: Surprisingly Accessible Jobs That Pay Well In Ethiopia. General Managers Now, this is an obvious choice, however, there is a lack of managers in the country and usually this position is outsourced to foreign nationals. It isn’t because the lack of qualified individuals but a lack of applicants. To engage in this career stream, one needs to have 10+ years of diversified experience in managing businesses and human resource management. The salary ranges from 40,000 birr for local companies to 500,000 birr for international corporations. The trend is coming as locals are opening new ventures and investment is booming so this is a worthy career path to invest 10 years in. Technical Sales This position is usually not known by many engineering graduates and usually this sectors suffers from a lack of openings as jobs are scarce in the area. This stream offers a great way of earning wages and gaining experience in the latest tech that is getting important as well as opening one up to the industry. What does a Technical Sales person do? Basically it’s a sales person with a technical knowledge about machines. Usually people with an engineering degree are encouraged to apply and you don’t need 10+years to get the job. If you work hard you could make upwards of 4000$(roughly 80,000 birr) a month. Project Manager Project managers are the people in charge of a specific project or projects within a company. As the project manager, your job is to plan, budget, oversee and document all aspects of the specific project you are working on. They can work at an NGO or a government office, however here we mean people that get companies started. Before any company gets started it needs to go through processes, machineries imported, land rented, employees hired and so on and so forth. A project manager makes sure that happens. For this they get paid from 50,000 to 100,000 birr a month, to get this job you need a diverse CV and at least 10 years of experience. SHE managers Safety Healthy and Environment(SHE) managers, do exactly what that says. They make companies safer and better by analyzing the workplace rules, safety regulations and other things. This service is growing and there is a demand for it and the pay is growing, this can pay up to 70 thousand birr. There is only one university that provides the degree for it (Gondar University) but you can get a job as a SHE manager if you have a background in industrial engineering. based on Ethiojobs data analysis

Yes, Tesfa is right. The NGOs are the top paid positions. There are also a number of government posts where you get small amount of official salary; but grab huge amount of government money by going out field works for every little activity. Those areas where you have to go for a field work, you get 10 times your salary every month. That is another way of getting big money while still enjoying your trips with the government car and infrastructure. Agriculture is one of these; health another of these fields.
